definition: to get into disarray/to get out of whack

sentences.english: Criminologists studied price-gouging and the breakdown of social order.
sentences.chinese: 犯罪學家則研究哄擡物價及社會失序的情況。

sentences.english: The optimistic synchronization is used to overcome disorder with little probability.
sentences.chinese: 同時結合樂觀機制來克服小概率的時間失序。

sentences.english: Seem to me that something is out of whack, not someone.
sentences.chinese: 在我看來，這是社會制度失序，並非某個人。

sentences.english: I have no order, I am in deep disorder.
sentences.chinese: 我沒有秩序，我處於深深的失序中。

sentences.english: Now there is disorder because there is division.
sentences.chinese: 而如今存在的失序，是因爲有劃分。

sentences.english: The European and American economic motors are out of order. China has stepped in.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲和美國的經濟驅動已經失序了，中國走了進來。

sentences.english: “Lord of Misrule,” for example, has a full cloth cover and a stitched binding, which is practically unheard of these days.
sentences.chinese: 《失序之王》用的就是現在鮮見的全布和縫紉裝訂。

definition: the situation (e.g. political)/the state of the world
to such an extent as to/down to/up to
down to/up to/to such an extent as to .../also written 以至於|以至于[yi3 zhi4 yu2]
variant of 擁塞|拥塞[yong1 se4]
to become more and more/to gradually become
